title: Public Campaign Action Fund
text: On Monday, June 9, 2008, Campaign Money Watch released a TV ad, now airing in the Washington, D.C., market (and posted at YouTube ), regarding John McCain’s intervention in an Air Force contract worth up to $100 billion that was awarded to Airbus, its parent company, and partners. Seven lobbyists aiding John McCain’s campaign worked for Airbus’ American affiliate, and McCain received more in campaign contributions from them than any other politician. Supporting documentation is included below. posted by Adam Smith on 10-30-2008 Published in: campaign contributions | FEC | florida | Mel Martinez 0 comments | read more posted by Adam Smith on 10-29-2008 Published in: Clean Elections | Congress | Connecticut | maine | New York 0 comments | read more posted by Adam Smith on 10-27-2008 Published in: Alaska | Ted Stevens 0 comments | read more Public Campaign Action Fund 1320 19th St, NW Suite #M-1 | Washington, DC 20036 info@pcactionfund.org | (P) 202.293.0222 | (F) 202.293.0202 Public Campaign Action Fund 1320 19th St, NW Suite #M-1 | Washington, DC 20036 info@pcactionfund.org | (P) 202.293.0222 | (F) 202.293.0202 powered by Drupal
